speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: SCENE VIII. Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Enter GOWER and WILLIAMS

speaker: WILLIAMS
text_entry: I warrant it is to knight you, captain.

speaker: WILLIAMS
text_entry: Enter FLUELLEN

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: God's will and his pleasure, captain, I beseech you

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: now, come apace to the king: there is more good

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: toward you peradventure than is in your knowledge to dream of.

speaker: WILLIAMS
text_entry: Sir, know you this glove?

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: Know the glove! I know the glove is glove.

speaker: WILLIAMS
text_entry: I know this; and thus I challenge it.

speaker: WILLIAMS
text_entry: Strikes him

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: 'Sblood! an arrant traitor as any is in the

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: universal world, or in France, or in England!

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: How now, sir! you villain!

speaker: WILLIAMS
text_entry: Do you think I'll be forsworn?

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: Stand away, Captain Gower; I will give treason his

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: payment into ploughs, I warrant you.

speaker: WILLIAMS
text_entry: I am no traitor.

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: That's a lie in thy throat. I charge you in his

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: majesty's name, apprehend him: he's a friend of the

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: Duke Alencon's.

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: Enter WARWICK and GLOUCESTER

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: How now, how now! what's the matter?

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: My Lord of Warwick, here is--praised be God for it!

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: --a most contagious treason come to light, look

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: you, as you shall desire in a summer's day. Here is

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: his majesty.

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: Enter KING HENRY and EXETER

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: How now! what's the matter?

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: My liege, here is a villain and a traitor, that,

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: look your grace, has struck the glove which your

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: majesty is take out of the helmet of Alencon.

speaker: WILLIAMS
text_entry: My liege, this was my glove; here is the fellow of

speaker: WILLIAMS
text_entry: it; and he that I gave it to in change promised to

speaker: WILLIAMS
text_entry: wear it in his cap: I promised to strike him, if he

speaker: WILLIAMS
text_entry: did: I met this man with my glove in his cap, and I

speaker: WILLIAMS
text_entry: have been as good as my word.

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: Your majesty hear now, saving your majesty's

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: manhood, what an arrant, rascally, beggarly, lousy

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: knave it is: I hope your majesty is pear me

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: testimony and witness, and will avouchment, that

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: this is the glove of Alencon, that your majesty is

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: give me; in your conscience, now?

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Give me thy glove, soldier: look, here is the

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: fellow of it.

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: 'Twas I, indeed, thou promised'st to strike;

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: And thou hast given me most bitter terms.

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: An please your majesty, let his neck answer for it,

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: if there is any martial law in the world.

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: How canst thou make me satisfaction?

speaker: WILLIAMS
text_entry: All offences, my lord, come from the heart: never

speaker: WILLIAMS
text_entry: came any from mine that might offend your majesty.

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: It was ourself thou didst abuse.

speaker: WILLIAMS
text_entry: Your majesty came not like yourself: you appeared to

speaker: WILLIAMS
text_entry: me but as a common man; witness the night, your

speaker: WILLIAMS
text_entry: garments, your lowliness; and what your highness

speaker: WILLIAMS
text_entry: suffered under that shape, I beseech you take it for

speaker: WILLIAMS
text_entry: your own fault and not mine: for had you been as I

speaker: WILLIAMS
text_entry: took you for, I made no offence; therefore, I

speaker: WILLIAMS
text_entry: beseech your highness, pardon me.

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Here, uncle Exeter, fill this glove with crowns,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: And give it to this fellow. Keep it, fellow;

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: And wear it for an honour in thy cap

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Till I do challenge it. Give him the crowns:

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: And, captain, you must needs be friends with him.

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: By this day and this light, the fellow has mettle

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: enough in his belly. Hold, there is twelve pence

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: for you; and I pray you to serve Got, and keep you

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: out of prawls, and prabbles' and quarrels, and

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: dissensions, and, I warrant you, it is the better for you.

speaker: WILLIAMS
text_entry: I will none of your money.

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: It is with a good will; I can tell you, it will

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: serve you to mend your shoes: come, wherefore should

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: you be so pashful? your shoes is not so good: 'tis

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: a good silling, I warrant you, or I will change it.

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: Enter an English Herald

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Now, herald, are the dead number'd?

speaker: Herald
text_entry: Here is the number of the slaughter'd French.

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: What prisoners of good sort are taken, uncle?

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: Charles Duke of Orleans, nephew to the king;

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: John Duke of Bourbon, and Lord Bouciqualt:

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: Of other lords and barons, knights and squires,

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: Full fifteen hundred, besides common men.

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: This note doth tell me of ten thousand French

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: That in the field lie slain: of princes, in this number,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: And nobles bearing banners, there lie dead

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: One hundred twenty six: added to these,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Of knights, esquires, and gallant gentlemen,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Eight thousand and four hundred; of the which,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Five hundred were but yesterday dubb'd knights:

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: So that, in these ten thousand they have lost,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: There are but sixteen hundred mercenaries;

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: The rest are princes, barons, lords, knights, squires,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: And gentlemen of blood and quality.

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: The names of those their nobles that lie dead:

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Charles Delabreth, high constable of France;

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Jaques of Chatillon, admiral of France;

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: The master of the cross-bows, Lord Rambures;

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Great Master of France, the brave Sir Guichard Dolphin,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: John Duke of Alencon, Anthony Duke of Brabant,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: The brother of the Duke of Burgundy,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: And Edward Duke of Bar: of lusty earls,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Grandpre and Roussi, Fauconberg and Foix,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Beaumont and Marle, Vaudemont and Lestrale.

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Here was a royal fellowship of death!

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Where is the number of our English dead?

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Herald shews him another paper

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Edward the Duke of York, the Earl of Suffolk,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Sir Richard Ketly, Davy Gam, esquire:

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: None else of name; and of all other men

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: But five and twenty. O God, thy arm was here;

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: And not to us, but to thy arm alone,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Ascribe we all! When, without stratagem,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: But in plain shock and even play of battle,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Was ever known so great and little loss

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: On one part and on the other? Take it, God,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: For it is none but thine!

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: 'Tis wonderful!

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Come, go we in procession to the village.

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: And be it death proclaimed through our host

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: To boast of this or take the praise from God

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Which is his only.

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: Is it not lawful, an please your majesty, to tell

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: how many is killed?

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Yes, captain; but with this acknowledgement,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: That God fought for us.

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: Yes, my conscience, he did us great good.

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Do we all holy rites;

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Let there be sung 'Non nobis' and 'Te Deum;'

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: The dead with charity enclosed in clay:

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: And then to Calais; and to England then:

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Where ne'er from France arrived more happy men.

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Exeunt
